maml:description.maml:para: Add a definition of an Active Directory domain or forest to the lab

Adds a definition of an Active Directory domain or forest name together with username which will be the administrator of the domain as well as the password. This information is used for AutomatedLab to be able to logon to all machines during and after deployment using domain credentials when needed.
Name of Active Directory domain or forest in FQDN format.
Desired username of the administrator when deploying a new lab or existing user of the administrator if adding to a lab or an existing external (not deployed by AutomatedLab) domain.
Desired password of the administrator when deploying a new lab or password of an existing administrator if adding to a lab or an existing external (not deployed by AutomatedLab) domain.
Whether or not to return the actual created domain definition in the call of this function to enable you to continue working on a pipeline
Name of Active Directory domain or forest in FQDN format.
Desired username of the administrator when deploying a new lab or existing user of the administrator if adding to a lab or an existing external (not deployed by AutomatedLab) domain.
Desired password of the administrator when deploying a new lab or password of an existing administrator if adding to a lab or an existing external (not deployed by AutomatedLab) domain.
Whether or not to return the actual created domain definition in the call of this function to enable you to continue working on a pipeline
Adds a definition of an ISO file using a logical name and a path of the ISO file

When AutomatedLab are to install roles like SQL Server, Exchange, Visual Studio, Office etc, it must know where to find the ISO file for these products. AutomatedLab does this by associating a logical name with a definition of an ISO file by path. This way, when AutomatedLab needs an ISO file, it looks for this "mapping".

All operating system ISO files are detected automatically UNLESS the ISO files are not placed within the LabSources folder structure. If so, you must specify manually using Add-LabIsoImageDefinition, where the ISO file is located.
Logical name for reference.
Names are case sensitive. Built-in possible options: SQLServer2008 SQLServer2008R2 SQLServer2012 SQLServer2014 Exchange2013 VisualStudio Office2013
Path of ISO file
Logical name for reference.
Names are case sensitive. Built-in possible options: SQLServer2008 SQLServer2008R2 SQLServer2012 SQLServer2014 Exchange2013 VisualStudio Office2013
Path of ISO file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a definition of ISO file to be used when installing Server 2016.

NOTE. This is only necessary if the ISO files for operating systems are located outside the LabSources folder structure. If all ISOs for operating systems are placed inside the LabSources folder structure, they will be autodetected and information about these operating system will be cached. Hence, next deployments (assuming that the ISO file contents in the LabSources folder structure has not changed), AutomatedLab will skip detection and instead use cahed information since the operating system available is the same.
Adds a definition of ISO file to be used when installing SQL Server 2014.
Note that -Name parameter is case sensitive. Built-in possible options: SQLServer2008 SQLServer2008R2 SQLServer2012 SQLServer2014 Exchange2013 VisualStudio Office2013

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a definition of a machine to the lab
Adds a definition of a machine to the lab. This does not create the actual machine. It creates the information of how the machines should look like.
Name of machine Name must consist of characters a-z, A-Z, '-' or 0-9 and must be 1-15 in length.
Startup memory for machine or, if -MinMemory or -MaxMemory is not specified, static memory for machine. Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Minimum dynamic memory for machine Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Maximum dynamic memory for machine Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Virtual processor count for machine
Name of machine Name must consist of characters a-z, A-Z, '-' or 0-9 and must be 1-15 in length.
Startup memory for machine or, if -MinMemory or -MaxMemory is not specified, static memory for machine. Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Minimum dynamic memory for machine Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Maximum dynamic memory for machine Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Virtual processor count for machine
Name of machine Name must consist of characters a-z, A-Z, '-' or 0-9 and must be 1-15 in length.
Startup memory for machine or, if -MinMemory or -MaxMemory is not specified, static memory for machine. Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Minimum dynamic memory for machine Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Maximum dynamic memory for machine Specified in bytes and must be within range 128MB-128GB.
Virtual processor count for machine

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-MachineDefinition -Name Server1 -OperatingSystem 'Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview 5 SERVERDATACENTER' -ToolsPath 'C:\LabSources\MyLabTools1' -ToolsPathDestination 'C:\MyDistTools'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a definition of a Hyper-V machine with the name 'Server1' with the operating system of 'Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview 5 SERVERDATACENTER'. Machine will not be domain joined but be placed in workgroup.
All folders/files from path 'C:\LabSources\MyLabTools1' will be copied to the machine 'Server1' in this machine's local 'C:\MyDistTools' (before the machine is even started for the first time).
If omitting the -ToolsPathDestination parameter, the destination will be 'C:\Tools'.

If using a folder for tools folder for each machine in the lab ie C:\MyLabTools1\Server1, C:\MyLabTools1\Server2 etc, you can use 'C:\MyLabTools1\<machine>' and AutomatedLab will map using the name of each machine to find the tools folder.

Following parameters for the machine, will be auto-configured: - Memory - Processors - IPv4 address and subnet mask - DNS server - Regional settings (will be set to match the host machine) - Time zone (will be set to match the host machine) - Userlocale (will be set to match the host machine) - Windows firewall is disabled - Hyper-V switch or Azure virtual network depending on -DefaultVirtualizationEngine parameter used for New-LabDefinition or -VirtualizationEngine parameter used for this function (Add-LabMachineDefinition)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-MachineDefinition -Name Server1 -OperatingSystem 'Windows Server 2008 R2 SERVERDATACENTER' -VirtualizationHost HyperV -Memory 1GB -MinMemory 512MB -MaxMemory 2GB -DomainName 'contoso.com'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a definition of a Hyper-V machine with the name 'Server1' with the operating system of 'Windows Server 2008 R2 SERVERDATACENTER'.
Startup memory will be 1GB ie what the machine boots with. Once started, the machine wil be using dynamic memory with 512MB and 2GB as lower and upper limits.
Machine will be joined to the domain 'contoso.com'.

Following parameters for the machine, will be auto-configured: - Processors - IPv4 address and subnet mask - DNS server - Regional settings (will be set to match the host machine) - Time zone (will be set to match the host machine) - Userlocale (will be set to match the host machine) - Windows firewall is disabled - Hyper-V switch or Azure virtual network depending on -DefaultVirtualizationEngine parameter used for New-LabDefinition or -VirtualizationEngine parameter used for this function (Add-LabMachineDefinition)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-MachineDefinition -Name Server1 -OperatingSystem 'Windows Server 2012 R2 SERVERDATACENTER' -OperatingSystemVersion 6.3.9600.17415 -VirtualizationHost HyperV -Processors 2 -Memory 2GB -IpAddress '192.168.100.5/24' -Network Network1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a definition of a Hyper-V machine with the name 'Server1' with the operating system of 'Windows Server 2012 R2 SERVERDATACENTER' with build version of '6.3.9600.17415'.
This is useful when testing specific functionality in specific builds for comparison.
Processors will be set to 2.
Memory will be set to 2GB (static).
IPv4 address will be set to '192.168.100.5' with a network mask of 255.255.255.0.
Network (Hyper-V switch) will be set to 'Network1'

Following parameters for the machine, will be auto-configured: - DNS Server - Regional settings (will be set to match the host machine) - Time zone (will be set to match the host machine) - Userlocale (will be set to match the host machine) - Windows firewall is disabled

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-MachineDefinition -Name Server1 -OperatingSystem 'Windows Server 2012 R2 SERVERDATACENTER' -VirtualizationHost HyperV -DefaultDomain -ProductKey 'ABCDE-ABCDE-ABCDE-ABCDE-ABCDE'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a definition of a Hyper-V machine with the name 'Server1' with the operating system of 'Windows Server 2012 R2 SERVERDATACENTER'.
This is useful when testing specific functionality in specific builds for comparison.
Processors will be set to 2.
Memory will be set to 2GB (static).
IPv4 address will be set to '192.168.100.5' with a network mask of 255.255.255.0.
Machine will be joined to the first domain defined in the lab.
Product key specified will be configured.

Following parameters for the machine, will be auto-configured: - Memory - Processors - IPv4 address and subnet mask - DNS server - Regional settings (will be set to match the host machine) - Time zone (will be set to match the host machine) - Userlocale (will be set to match the host machine) - Windows firewall is disabled

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a definition of a virtual network

For Hyper-V, a definition of a virtual switch is created associated with the address space for the virtual switch. For Azure, a definition of a virtual network is created associated with the address space for the virtual network.
Name of virtual network
Address space of virtual network defined in the format '192.168.10.0/24'
Virtualization engine for network
Extra properties for Hyper-V based virtual network. Options are; type of virtual switch and name of physical adapter to connect to (if type of virtual switch is 'External')

Extra properties for Azure based virtual network. Options are: SubnetName: Name of subnet to be create inside the virtual network. SubnetAddressPrefix: If a subnet of another size than the virtual network is desired, use this parameter to specify this. LocationName: Azure Datacenter of where to create the virtual network. DnsServers: DNS servers for the virtual network. All machines in the virtual network will be configured to use these DNS servers if they are not configured manually. ConnectToVnets: If specified, a VPN gateway will be created and configure to connect the network being created with the network(s) specified by this parameter.
Wheter or not the virtual network will be returned as an object
Name of virtual network
Address space of virtual network defined in the format '192.168.10.0/24'
Virtualization engine for network
Extra properties for Hyper-V based virtual network. Options are; type of virtual switch and name of physical adapter to connect to (if type of virtual switch is 'External')

Extra properties for Azure based virtual network. Options are: SubnetName: Name of subnet to be create inside the virtual network. SubnetAddressPrefix: If a subnet of another size than the virtual network is desired, use this parameter to specify this. LocationName: Azure Datacenter of where to create the virtual network. DnsServers: DNS servers for the virtual network. All machines in the virtual network will be configured to use these DNS servers if they are not configured manually. ConnectToVnets: If specified, a VPN gateway will be created and configure to connect the network being created with the network(s) specified by this parameter.
Wheter or not the virtual network will be returned as an object

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a definition of a virtual network with the name 'Network1' and with an address space of 192.168.10.0/24 (which is a subnet mask of 255.255.255.0). Hyper-V machines can then be configured (defined) to use this network using -Network parameter. Virtual switch type will be internal.

Adds a definition of a virtual network with the name 'Network2' but without an address space. When starting deployment, the address space will be determined by automatically scanning for an available address space. Hyper-V machines can then be configured (defined) to use this network using -Network parameter. Virtual switch type will be internal.

Adds a definition of a virtual network with the name 'Network3' and with an address space of 192.168.0.0/16 (which is a subnet mask of 255.255.0.0). Azure machines can then be configured (defined) to use this network using -Network parameter.

Adds a definition of a virtual network with the name 'Network4' and with an address space of 192.168.0.0/16 (which is a subnet mask of 255.255.0.0). A subnet will be created inside the virtual network called 'Subnet1'. Virtual network will be placed in Azure data center 'West Europe'. DNS server for virtual network will be '192.168.10.4' and a VPN gateway will be created and configured to route between the network created ('Network4') and 'Network8'' Azure machines can then be configured (defined) to use this network using -Network parameter.

Adds a definition of a virtual network with the name 'Network5' and with an address space of 192.168.10.0/24 (which is a subnet mask of 255.255.255.0). Type of Hyper-V virtual switch will be external and connected/bridged to the physical adapter with the name 'Ethernet adapter vEthernet (External)'. Machines can then be configured (defined) to use this network using -Network parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Measures the disk speed of the specified logical drive letter
Measures the disk speed of the specified logical drive letter. This is used by AutomatedLab when determining optimal placement of harddisk files of Hyper-V virtual machines
Drive letter to measure
Number of measurements to perform
Drive letter to measure
Number of measurements to perform

dev:remarks.maml:para: Measure disk speed of drive C
Measure disk speed of drive D using 5 iterations (repetetive measurements) and return average measurement

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the lab definition
Retrieves all lab definition information

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all lab definition information

maml:description.maml:para: Returns all definitions of Active Directory domains/forest in the lab
Returns all definitions of Active Directory domains/forest in the lab
Returns all machine definitions in the lab
Returns all machine definitions in the lab
Returns all existing virtual networks (switches) on a Hyper-V host
Returns all existing virtual networks (switches) on a Hyper-V host
Returns all virtual network definitions in the lab
eturns all virtual network definitions in the lab
Creates a new lab definition
Needed for defining a lab definition which is a mandatory 'container' for the lab to be deployed. To be called before any other function of AutomatedLab.
Name of lab. Name must only contain character a-z, A-Z and 0-9.
Path of placement of lab XML files containing the lab configuration
Path of placement of Hyper-V based machines
Specifies the size of the base disk to create for each used Operating System
Maximum memory to use for lab if using automatic configuration of memory for each machine (by not specifying the memory at all)

Instructs AutomatedLab to use 80% of all available memory for the lab where the machines will split this memory in a weighted approach based on what role(s) the machines are to have. This is only true if the memory is NOT specified when defining machine using Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Instructs AutomatedLab to only configure static memory for all machines if using automatic configuration of memory for each machine (by not specifying the memory at all).
Virtualization engine to use as default for the lab. When not specifying the -VirtualizationHost parameter
Specifying what Azure subscription to use as default. This could be needed if having more than one Azure subscription to make sure a specific subscription is used.
Name of lab. Name must only contain character a-z, A-Z and 0-9.
Path of placement of lab XML files containing the lab configuration
Path of placement of Hyper-V based machines
Specifies the size of the base disk to create for each used Operating System
Maximum memory to use for lab if using automatic configuration of memory for each machine (by not specifying the memory at all)

Instructs AutomatedLab to use 80% of all available memory for the lab where the machines will split this memory in a weighted approach based on what role(s) the machines are to have. This is only true if the memory is NOT specified when defining machine using Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Instructs AutomatedLab to only configure static memory for all machines if using automatic configuration of memory for each machine (by not specifying the memory at all).
Virtualization engine to use as default for the lab. When not specifying the -VirtualizationHost parameter
Specifying what Azure subscription to use as default. This could be needed if having more than one Azure subscription to make sure a specific subscription is used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1

Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1 and instructs AutomatedLab that all machines being added to the lab, is to be Hyper-V based machines unless anything else is specified using the -VirtualizationHost parameter on Add-LabMachineDefinition.
VMs (harddisks etc) will be placed in the path of '<Letter>:\VMs' where <Letter> is automatically derived based on disk performance, free size available and if drive contains operating system or not.

Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1 and instructs AutomatedLab that all machines being added to the lab, is to be Azure based machines unless anything else is specified using the -VirtualizationHost parameter on Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Lab XML files (containing the lab configuration) will be placed in 'C:\MyLabs' as opposed to the default path of '<MyDocuments>\AutomatedLab-Labs'

Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1 and instructs AutomatedLab that all machines being added to the lab, is to be Hyper-V based machines unless anything else is specified using the -VirtualizationHost parameter on Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Lab XML files (containing the lab configuration) will be placed in 'C:\MyLabs' as opposed to the default path of '<MyDocuments>\AutomatedLab-Labs'.
VMs (harddisks etc) will be placed in the path of 'D:\VMs' as opposed to automatic placement based on disk performance, free size available and if drive contains operating system or not.

Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1 and instructs AutomatedLab that all machines being added to the lab, is to be Hyper-V based machines unless anything else is specified using the -VirtualizationHost parameter on Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Lab XML files (containing the lab configuration) will be placed in '<MyDocuments>\AutomatedLab-Labs'.
VMs (harddisks etc) will be placed in the path of '<Letter>:\VMs' where <Letter> is automatically derived based on disk performance, free size available and if drive contains operating system or not.

If 8GB of memory if more than 80% of the available memory, the memory will be limited to 8GB for the entire lab where the machines will split these 8GB in a weighted approach based on what role(s) the machines are to have. This is only true if the memory is NOT specified when defining machine using Add-LabMachineDefinition.

Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1 and instructs AutomatedLab that all machines being added to the lab, is to be Hyper-V based machines unless anything else is specified using the -VirtualizationHost parameter on Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Lab XML files (containing the lab configuration) will be placed in '<MyDocuments>\AutomatedLab-Labs'.
VMs (harddisks etc) will be placed in the path of '<Letter>:\VMs' where <Letter> is automatically derived based on disk performance, free size available and if drive contains operating system or not.

80% of all available memory will be used for the entire lab where the machines will split this memory in a weighted approach based on what role(s) the machines are to have. This is only true if the memory is NOT specified when defining machine using Add-LabMachineDefinition.

Creates a new lab definition with the name MyTestLab1 and instructs AutomatedLab that all machines being added to the lab, is to be Hyper-V based machines unless anything else is specified using the -VirtualizationHost parameter on Add-LabMachineDefinition.
Lab XML files (containing the lab configuration) will be placed in '<MyDocuments>\AutomatedLab-Labs'.
VMs (harddisks etc) will be placed in the path of '<Letter>:\VMs' where <Letter> is automatically derived based on disk performance, free size available and if drive contains operating system or not.
All machines will be using static memory as opposed the default dynamic memory.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a network adapter definition roughly interpreted as a NIC
Creates a network adapter definition roughly interpreted as a NIC. This NIC can then be connected to a lab machine when defining the machine using Add-LabMachineDefinition
Validates the lab definition

Use this function to (manually) validate the lab definition before attempting to actually deploy it. A lot of checks is being done which can potentially avoid issues up front instead of having to wait for these to occur during deployment and perhaps after considerably long time.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Performs validation of the lab saved in the file 'D:\MyLabs\MyTestLab\Lab.xml'

Type Message TargetObject ---- ------- ------------ Information Role defined RootDC Information Role defined FirstChildDC Information Role defined DC Information Machine defined in lab DC1 Information Machine defined in lab DC2 Information Machine defined in lab DC3 Information Machine defined in lab SRV1 Information Domain defined contoso.com Information Domain defined child.contoso.com Summary Ok Lab
True
Performs validation of the lab saved in the file 'D:\MyLabs\MyTestLab\Lab.xml'.
Detailed output will be suppressed and only true or false will be returned. True if validation succeedes, false if not.
True
